channel.title: Freedom of Speech
channel.description:
Where do you think the line should be drawn under Freedom of Speech, or should we be completly free to say what we want, when we want?
A lot of people use "Freedom of Speech" as an excuse to incite hatred and hostility towards certain groups of people, sometimes you may find yourself offended and shocked at what certain people say but does that mean they shouldn't be allowed to say it? For example in the UK we have a national party called the BNP, they are against gay couples expressing relations in public and think the majority of immigrants should not be allowed in our country because they are freeloaders, instead of allowing them to voice there opinion the public shout them down, boo and jeer, like some sort of medieval hanging trail, should the BNP not be free to say these things without being shouted down, or is shouting them down freedom of speech also?
Another group who have caused great controversy in our country, is Islam4UK, who have been talking about protesting at a remembrance march in a small village against how we "hero" worship our soldiers, is that freedom of speech or is that just inciting hate (If there is a difference)? And does this group have the right to say that if we can hold remembrance marches for soldiers who died in Iraq and Afghanistan, they should be allowed to have marches for those who carried out the 9/11 and 7/7 terror attacks on the UK and America?
And have there been things in the news recently, in your country, which have made you question freedom of speech or has it angered you at how people have reacted to their controversial views or opinions?

Freedom of Speech should be given to people who wouldn’t abuse it and make blatant lies about everything

item.title: Freedom of Speech
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
I believe in freedom of posting, but there are some people that really make me mad. I think, that although you have “Freedom” of posting, there should be a barrier as to how far back you can stretch that Freedom. People who necro threads, and cause problems make excuses that it is their freedom of speech. Like I said, I agree in freedom of posting, but there is a line that you can cross in pretty much every thing, and once that line is crossed, I dont care about your freedom of speech if you don’t respect dead threads and use the rights you’ve been given intelligently.

Read full topic

item.title: Freedom of Speech
item.dc:creator: Fuskox
item.description:
I believe in freedom of speech, but there are some people that really make me mad. I think, that although you have “Freedom” of speech, there should be a barrier as to how far you can stretch that Freedom. People who protest things, and cause problems make excuses that it is their freedom of speech. Like I said, I agree in freedom of speech, but there is a line that you can cross in pretty much every thing, and once that line is crossed, I don’t care about your freedom of speech if you don’t respect others and use the rights you’ve been given intelligently.

Read full topic

item.title: Freedom of Speech
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Imonfire:

You’re aware that you just linked to The Onion, right?

Yeah, but God actually made that speech, I was totally there. In all seriousness, I found that article to be one of the most moving calls for religious compatibility that I’ve ever known of, which I felt made it relevant. Ah, the power of satire.
